page.title: 13SOME HISTORY OF CURDWORTH
page.content: IN SAXON TIMES, A CLEARING IN THE FOREST OF ARDEN NEAR TO THE RIVER TAME BECAME THE VILLAGE KNOWN TODAY AS CURDWORTH. DOMESDAY BOOK POPULATION 22 1986 1172 THE CHURCH OF ST. NICHOLAS 1165 HAS MEDIEVAL WALL PAINTINGS; THE LARGEST KNOWN CHEST CARVED FROM THE TRUNK OF AN OAK AND 2 FONTS. THE FIRST SKIRMISH OF THE CIVIL WAR FOUGHT IN FIELD ADJACENT TO THE CHURCH. LONDON TURNPIKE PASSED THROUGH VILLAGE. HOSTELRIES USED BY COACHMEN FOR CHANGING HORSES AND PASSENGER REFRESHMENT ARE NOW PRIVATE HOUSES. RED LION COTTAGE RECEIVED CIVIC AWARD 1984. WORKERS COTTAGES OWNED BY LOCAL LANDLORD IN EIGHTEEN HUNDREDS NOW MODERN HOMES. OF CURDWORTH HALL ONLY THE FISH KEEP POND REMAINS WITH PART OF THE MOAT STILL TRACEABLE. SAND STONE FROM HALL USED TO BUILD RIVER BRIDGE CANAL CUT ABOUT 1790.
